column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Where
#Text=MSAs are being used around the world , huge cost savings are being realized .
#Text=More importantly , research shows these cost savings are not resulting in a decline in people ’s health .
#Text=The cost savings achieved through MSAs will be re-invested in healthcare areas such as long term care , pharmacare and expensive medical technologies .

#Text=Lastly , the MSA plan is the only party plan that provides an incentive for eating well , quitting smoking and getting exercise : take care of your body , and you will stay away from the doctor and avoid paying the Liberal Health Tax .
#Text=Further , unused portions of MSAs can be rolled into RRSPs .
#Text=The shortage of healthcare professionals will be dealt with by increasing compensation packages to attract doctors and nurses to the province .
#Text=These compensation packages are needed to win over doctors and nurses in the international bidding war to Ontario .
#Text=Prioritizing the provincial budget will pay for the big expense of winning the bidding war for healthcare expenses .
#Text=This means cuts in other government areas will be necessary .
#Text=Issue #2 : Farming
#Text=The Family Coalition Party has always believed that the family farm is one of the basic building blocks of Ontario ’s economy .
#Text=The FCP will propose “ Right to Farm ” legislation .
#Text=The farming sector must be free to operate responsibly , without interference regarding standard farm operating practices .
#Text=The FCP will continue to support the responsible use of approved chemicals in agriculture .
#Text=Lastly , I propose an “ Adopt-a-Steer ” program so that farmers can sell their meat locally at a value-added price .
#Text=Under our current system , farmers receive the smallest fraction of the cost of beef that people pay at the store .
#Text=If I want to buy my neighbour ’s meat , I should be able to , and it is good for the farmer .
#Text=Issue #3 : Infrastructure
#Text=The infrastructure of roads , bridges and water systems is crumbling in Ontario .
#Text=Investment in safety sensitive infrastructure areas is essential .
#Text=I propose the creation of reserve accounts in municipal budgets for water systems , for example .
#Text=These accounts need an initial cash infusion from the provincial government over the short term until the reserve accounts are self-sustaining through a portion of property tax rates .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=The first thing I would do is introduce legislation banning sex-selection abortions .
#Text=Even China has a law like this .
#Text=Ontario should not be second to China for anything when it comes to human rights .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=Most people do not believe they receive good value for the property taxes they pay .
#Text=In general , people used to pay $ 1.00 and got $ 1.30 in services .
#Text=Now we pay $ 1.00 and get $ 0.70 back in services .
#Text=The FCP is committed to freezing the education portion of property tax rates .
#Text=We will remove the education portion of taxes from agricultural lands .
#Text=Concerning Market Value Assessment increases , if a significant increase is required , it must be phased in over time .
#Text=Halting provincial downloading that forces higher expenses on municipalities and towns can also relieve property taxes .

#Text=Lastly , property taxes going up are also a response to the pressures of an aging population with a shrinking tax base , so we either need to lower our expectations of government and pay less taxes ; or have more babies .
